Therapist should state their name at least once during the session.
Therapist should summarize the client's main concern before offering advice.
Therapist should ask open-ended questions to encourage client reflection.
Therapist should validate the client's feelings explicitly.
Therapist should provide a brief recap at the end of the session.
Therapist should avoid making assumptions about the client's experiences.
Therapist should check for understanding after giving feedback.
Therapist should maintain a nonjudgmental tone throughout the conversation.
Therapist should invite the client to set goals for future sessions.
Therapist should clarify any ambiguous statements made by the client.
